column5: Hi all,  Went out from 2pm till around 4pm. What an awesome session.  I lucked out with the first hole drilled, fish all over the screen, wallies on the bottom and schools of baitfish at 20' FOW over 50' FOW.  It wasn't 10 minutes and the auger was still hot by the time i had 3 keepers on the ice. I took 20 minutes to drill a few holes 100yrds away on a spot i had got them last year, came back and iced a few more keeper size before moving to the new holes.  Same kind of depth, only its a steeper drop from a 20' shelf i marked in the summer. Lots of keeper size again, then just like last year i spotted a fish way up at 20' FOW over 50' FOW, reeled up quick to whwere it was, the fish slammed it! a nice 23".  Lost one at the hole trying to get the camera out, again it was around 24". Both those fish were suspended at 20' over 50', just like last year. Anyone who is undecided about getting a flasher/fishfinder for the ice...dont...JUST GET ONE! I would have missed both those fish as i was jigging at the bottom when i saw them come in some 30' above my jig...reeled up and SLAM!   Just before 4pm i started to pack up, went to get my set line (which saw no action until i moved it) dropped the transducer down and gave it a sharp jig. No sooner than that a fish screamed of bottom and nailed it. It felt small at first but turned out very close to 27"! All fish on 1/4 white jig with a tail hooked minnow...largish minnows.  Anyways...here's the vid and some piccies.   <object width="480" height="385"><param name="movie" value="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qhHV8QCyy3s?fs=1&hl=en_US"></param><param'>http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qhHV8QCyy3s?fs=1&hl=en_US"></param><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"></param><param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param><embed src="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qhHV8QCyy3s?fs=1&hl=en_US" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" allowscriptaccess="always" allowfullscreen="true" width="480" height="385"></embed></object>
nice going  wish I could get some walleye around there this time of year
man Simon, you are killing me!  I'll PM you my addy so you can send some down here, lol.  It's a few more weeks here before we can go for them.

I've said it before and say it again.... you're in walleye heaven up there Simon Excellent report... I love it Got to love hooking the biggest fish last    That was a super nice one Keep up the great work and thanks for sharing!!! Jacques
Ya know with all the technical capability they have nowadays, you'd think they could come up with a smell-a-screen or taste-a-screen, they just look like a good decoration for my frying pan..

Wow!!!!!   Now I know what my friend is talking about the fishing up that way!!!! Gonna have to make it up there sometime in the next year. I got an invitation LoL   Awesome fishing, good for you!!! Bet you had an awesome dinner   Sexy pink gloves btw
awesome, you're lucky to live up there, alot of us in the GTA are jealous
nice eyes simon congrats
Yummmm...Nice pickereye! Couple more weeks to go till open season.
Great walleyes. You limeys sure know how to ice fish!
You really make it easy to hate you.
Nice work Simon.  Gotta love suspended walleye - they're almost always active fish.  BTW - nice gloves, pink is your colour!!
Really enjoy your video reports Simon. Wish I was closer to you to come and join you once  Cheers, Ice Fisherman
Nice eyes. Bravo.
Yep Simon, you get to play in Gods country everyday ..... I keep staring at my ice fishing gear  ... Jan 1st for me
Great report, pics and video as always. Keep them coming.
Totally awesome...can't believe the eyes you get into...man!!!!  Are your laker spots going to be ready for the 1st?

I'm not the first to mention this but I LOOOVVES your pink GLOOOVVES.  I'm gonna print off the part of your post where you say "Anyone who is undecided about getting a flasher/fishfinder for the ice...dont...JUST GET ONE!" and show it to my GF. I'll tell her you are a bona-fide fishing authority figure and maybe I'll get the thumbs up. (hopefully not a thumb up the  )  Nice post as usual, a lot of walleye fisherman here have a lot of catching up to do, included me-self.
Real men eat quiche and wear pick gloves I guess. Excellent report Simon!! What a way to kill some time before work.
Some fine looking walleye Simon. Would have loved to be there. Oh well, after Christmas I guess.

First off....I'd like to wish everyone a belated HAPPY XMAS!  Thanks for the replies folks, i actually snuck out for an hour same spot Xmas eve ( i just worked out how to snowmachine right from my yard to this lake across our lake and on the trails a bit!) Same scenario as in the report, first line down...WHAM!.....thgen.....NOTHING   oh well...thats fishing.      If ya think the gloves are sexy...you should see......lol...never mind.    Another vote for the gloves, and after the recent fac3book status you replied to Ben...it dont look good on my part.  Your right of course about the suspended fish...they is HUNTING!.....as soon as you get your jig in front of them...WHAM!...LOVE IT!    Icefisherman...if you ever do venture up the timmies is on me and we'll hit the hardwater (or softqwater) for sure.    JAN 1ST...CANT WAIT...LAKERS!   Hey JB...how did you get on on Nungessor? Anyway, the ice is surprisingly....AWESOME! The minus -30 celcius cold snap we had for a whole week after the horrendous dump of snow has firmed everything up, even better there is no slush on the lakes i have been to so far, just a nice 5" coating of snow on top of 9" to 15" of ice!    Another vote for the gloves.....you'll all be wearing them soon...NOT!  Pssssst, i know i have a Lowrance ....but those Hummingbird 345c and 385c hummingbirds look interesting.   I hate Quiche!    Hey Gord, i'm skipping across to the Twin Towers and into Thunder on the 2nd January...up for it?
Would love to, but I'll be on the road that day travelling.  Maybe the weekend after?
I'm off Sunday 9th Jan...sounds good.

Limey, great report as usual!  Another two weeks to wait for my ice fishing, but you should try to make it down my way for a day or two, lots of 10-12lb walleye about 1/4 mile from my house, always lotsa fun!
